meanings.sent1: The intricacies of the puzzle were challenging to unravel.
meanings.sent2: She studied the intricacies of the painting to understand its true meaning.
meanings.sent3: Trying to navigate the intricacies of the new software felt like a fun brain teaser.
meanings.sent4: The intricacies of the legal system can be compared to a maze with hidden paths.
meanings.sent5: The intricacies of the dance routine required hours of practice to perfect.

meanings.definition: The state of being intricate or complicated
meanings.sent1: He was fascinated by the intricacies of the human brain.
meanings.sent2: The intricacies of the plot kept the audience engaged until the end.
meanings.sent3: The intricacies of planning a surprise party without being caught were amusing.
meanings.sent4: The intricacies of relationships can sometimes feel like a tangled web.
meanings.sent5: The intricacies of the problem became clearer after discussing it with a friend.
